south_african.text: Two eyes help each other
A tree is known by its fruit.
Where there is honey, there are bound to be ants.
You are not great just because you say you are.
Even the maid has a family.
He who has no intelligence is happy with it.
He. He. He. You begin with the meal before the water is boiling.
Hope does not kill; I shall live in hope of getting what I seek another day.
If he keeps on imitating everybody the monkey will one day cut his own throat.
If you are looking for a fly in your food it means that you are full.
If your buttocks burn, you know you have done wrong.
It is hunger that killed the man with many wives.
It is the snake that smells the rat.
Knowledge is like a lion; it cannot be gently embraced.
A chattering bird builds no nest.
A fool is a wise man's ladder.
A termite grows up in dry wood, and yet comes to maturity.
Abundance does not spread; famine does.
Almost is not eaten.
An Elder does not break wind in public, but in a latrine.
As great birds die the eggs rot.
Before you milk a cow tie it up.
Behold the iguana puffing itself out to make itself a man.
By pounding the dough the bread will rise.
No hill without gravestones, no valley without shadows.
No man can perfectly empty a pot with a ladle.
No one drinks medicine on behalf of a sick person.
No stake ever grew old with the bark on.
Old age does not announce itself.
Once you have found your first diamond, you will never give up looking.
One who enters a hut does not smell the termites roasting in the boiler.
people are people through other people.
Plenty sits still, hunger is a wanderer.
Roasted locusts eaten at night bring dangerous dreams.
Until the lions have their historians, tales of hunting will always glorify the hunter.
Walls have ears, and little pots too.
What the poor man says is not listened to.
When a bird builds its nest it uses the feathers of other birds.
When the elephant is slain all the tribes gather together to eat of it.
When two elephants meet on a narrow bridge, they get nowhere until one of them backs down or lies down.
When you climb the mountain and reach the top, do not forget the branches shrubs that helped your footing.
When you have a lot to do, start with a meal.
When you have touched a woman, you have struck a rock.
When you shoot a zebra in the black stripe, the white dies too; shoot it in the white and the black dies too.
The best time to plant a tree is years ago; the next best time is now.
The drums of war are the drums of hunger.
The dupe who takes possession of a lame ox is seldom recognized as a fool.
The fool who owns an ox is seldom recognized as a fool.
The foot pains in sympathy with the toe.
The girl with stars in her eyes will shine like the moonlight.
The greatest death is laughter.
The hand that rocks the cradle rules the nation and its destiny.
The heart is like a goat that has to be tied up.
The impatient person eats goat; the one who hesitates eats beef.
The last partridge to rise gets the most sticks thrown at it.
The one chased away with a club comes back, but the one chased away with reason does not.
The pool has dried up, and the fish is in trouble.
The poor man's proverb is never quoted.
The quail waits for the stick; the idle loiterer about a place waits for a kick from an old boot.
The seed waits for its garden or ground where it will be sown.
The strength of the crocodile is in the water.
The woman who always complains and is never satisfied with anything is like an annoying flea on the foot.
A bad name is like a stigma.
A bird will always use another birds' feathers to feather its own nest.
A man's grave is by the roadside.
To kiss the child is to kiss the mother.
To travel is to see.
We are people because of other people.
What is seen is seen by all.
You can't keep a bull in the Kraal.
Eating without sharing is like swearing with your mouth.
Eyes can see widely: They can cross a river in full flood.
Famine hides under the granary.
He who offended forgets, but he who suffered from the offense does not.
If you are too smart to pay the doctor, you had better be too smart to get sick.
Plenty is like the mist.
The cripple is fair in its mother's eyes.
You have exposed yourself.
You will find out what Hili of the Amambalu experienced.
You will prefer roasted meat.
You will shed tears with one eye like a monkey.
They have slaughtered at Kukwane where much meat is obtainable.
They prevent us from getting red clay from the pit, and they do not use it.
Throats are all alike in swallowing
To skin a mouse.
We shall hear, we are on the side towards which the wind blows.
You are creeping on your knees to the fireplace.
You are lighting a fire in the wind.
You disturb monkeys on their way to drink.
You drink out of the old cup.
You have cast away your own for that which you are not sure of.
He is ripe inside, like a water-melon.
I rejoice that Kolomba's mother is dead.
I, the adhesive grass, will stick fast to you.
If we blink the eyes in order not to see a wicked person, how shall we be able to see a good person?
It dies and rises like the moon.
It has stuck fast by one of the front legs.
It is a cob stripped of maize in an ashpit.
It is not every one who is a son of Gaika.
It is the foot of a baboon.
It is the seed of the umya.
The land is dead.
The mist and the sun are together.
The people who rescue and kill.
The shield turned the wrong way.
The sun never sets without fresh news.
The walls have come into collision.
The wonderful and the impossible have come into collision.
There is no beast that does not roar in its den.
There is no wormwood that comes into flower and does not wither.
They are people of experience who do not sleep at a strange place.
Like the marriage feast of Mapassa.
Misfortune of soup made of shanks and feet.
No partridge scratches the ground in search of food for another.
One does not become great by claiming greatness.
One fly does not provide for another.
One who eats the remains of a meal without first obtaining permission.
The baldness of a head begins at the temples.
The coming of Nkele.
The crab has stuck fast between the stones at the entrance of its hole.
The foot has no nose.
A brand burns him who stirs it up.
A dog of the wind.
A person who will not take advice gets knowledge when trouble overtakes him.
A spy for both.
Bakuba is far away, no person ever reached it.
Guluwe's two of yesterday.
He has drunk the juice of the flower of the wild aloe.
He has fastened a dog to a shrub.
He has gone in pursuit of the birds of the sea.
He is a buck of an endless forest.
The mother is she who catches the knife by the blade.
The quick one may not win; the enduring one will.
To give away is to make provision for the future.
A person is a person because of other persons.
He that digs up a grave for his enemy, may be digging it for himself.
The wrong-headed fool who refuses counsel, will come to grief.
Two wives, two pots of poison.
Once the manioca is in your stomach it's gone.
A child brought up where there is always dancing cannot fail to dance.
Grow old, body, the heart still remains.
The tears of a man drop onto his chest.
Where there is a herd without a bull, a castrated ox will rule.
If you are looking for a fly in your food it means that you are full.
A crowd can easily overpower a bull.
Don’t meddle with a family feud.
Even an ant can hurt an elephant.
Even when there is no rooster, the morning will still start.
Hope does not disappoint.
The jungle is stronger than the elephant.
Do not expect to be offered a chair when you are visiting a place where the chief sits on the floor.
Money can’t talk, yet it can make lies look true.
Love, like rain, does not choose the grass on which it falls.
A clever king is the brother of peace.
The cook does not have to be a beautiful woman.
Money can’t talk, yet it can make lies look true.
If I am in harmony with my family, that’s success.
If your buttocks burn, you know you have done wrong.

No death is different.

Where there is honey, there are bound to be ants.

It shall dawn again tomorrow.
Let the hand go, let the hand come back.

The mouth can cross any river.
Until the lions have their historians, tales of hunting will always glorify the hunter.
Dawn doesn’t come twice to wake a person up.

The healer does not diagnose himself.
Greatness is not rushed for.
Growing is seeing.

A man takes from another man’s back.
